result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Thoma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 18 days were granted if revoked.
Concurrent with: 15CF1219
May be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $249.00 to be paid to Northface.  Bail applied to restitution.  Paid in full.
Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Remainder of costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with any victims in cases 16CF337, 15CF1218, 15CF1219, AND 15CF1526.
  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommenced.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber-STAYED for use at Agent's discretion, consecutive to any other sentence.
